result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Exhibit 1 - Housed in Vault Drawer

Case called @ 10:08 AM Defendant John Francis Kressin appeared by phone.  Attorney Walter Arthur Piel Jr. appeared by phone for John Francis Kressin.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. The Court has reviewed the squad video and the positions of each attorney. The Court marks the squad video as exhibit 1. No objection by either party. The Court receives exhibit 1. The Court requests clarification from DA Leusink regarding testimony of Deputy Schaut. Argument by DA Leusink. Argument by Atty Piel. The Court denies the motion to suppress for reasons stated on the record. Statement by DA Leusink regarding bind over. Atty Piel does object to bind over of the defendant. The Court does bind the defendant over for trial.
Arraignment scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Arraignment on November 17, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Letter to Court from DA Leusink in response to the motion to suppress evidentiary hearing held in September and brief in support of motion to suppress filed by Atty Piel on 10/20/2022
Letter to Court from DA Leusink with attached video/photos for the Court's review
Defendant's Brief in Support of Defendant's Motion for Suppression of Evidence
Notice of Hearing returned by USPS - Not Deliverable as Addressed - Unable to Forward
Petition to Stay Administrative Penalties
Request for Judicial Review
of 9/12/22 Preliminary Hearing

Case called @ 2:00 PM Defendant John Francis Kressin in court.  Attorney Walter Arthur Piel Jr. in court for John Francis Kressin.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Amended complaint stated. Receipt admitted - reading waived. Hearing to address the Preliminary Hearing and a Motion to Suppress filed by Atty Piel. Deputy Scott Schaut sworn in for testimony. Direct exam by DA Leusink. Witness identifies the defendant. 2:20 p.m. Cross exam by Atty Piel. 2:36 p.m. Witness excused. Evidence closed. Statement by Atty Piel - requesting the opportunity to review the video. DA Leusink will provide the video to Atty Piel and if there is no objection by Atty Piel it will be filed for the Court to review. The Court will then allow the parties an opportunity to brief the information. The Court holds in abeyance determination of probable cause. The Court orders the defense brief to be filed by October 20, 2022. State's response brief to be filed by no later than October 27, 2022.
Oral ruling scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Oral ruling on November 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Case called @ 2:47 PM: Defendant John Francis Kressin in court.  Attorney Walter Arthur Piel Jr. in court for John Francis Kressin.  Attorney Matthew Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment. Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The Court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. Statement by the Court regarding potential Motion to Suppress hearing. Atty Piel advises he will be filing a motion to suppress. No objections to motion hearing taking place alongside the preliminary hearing. DA Leusink advises discovery will be shared prior to the PH upon demand being filed by Atty Piel. Video will be made available to the Court for review prior to the PH. PH Scheduled - NOH Given. Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Cash Bond Signed - $5000 - 6/6/2022

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No operation of any motor vehicles.

Case called @ 1:11 PM Defendant John Francis Kressin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Wesley J Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein appeared by video for John Francis Kressin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Bond argument by ADA Kottke. Bond argument by Atty Blankschein. Court orders: $5000 cash bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
